input.content:
# Tests: Time-of-Day Theming

id: T-001
spec: S-001 (specs/01-time-of-day-theming.md)

---

## Functional Tests

### Scenario: Morning theme applied at 7am

**Given:** The current time is 7:00 AM
**When:** The app loads
**Then:** document.documentElement has data-time="morning"
**And:** --color-accent equals the morning palette terracotta value
**And:** Background has warm sunrise tones

### Scenario: Afternoon theme applied at 2pm

**Given:** The current time is 2:00 PM
**When:** The app loads
**Then:** document.documentElement has data-time="afternoon"
**And:** --color-accent equals the afternoon palette value
**And:** Background has bright midday tones

### Scenario: Evening theme applied at 7pm

**Given:** The current time is 7:00 PM
**When:** The app loads
**Then:** document.documentElement has data-time="evening"
**And:** --color-accent equals the evening palette golden value
**And:** Background has warm sunset tones

### Scenario: Night theme applied at 11pm

**Given:** The current time is 11:00 PM
**When:** The app loads
**Then:** document.documentElement has data-time="night"
**And:** --color-accent equals the night palette muted value
**And:** Background has cool restful tones

### Scenario: Theme transitions automatically

**Given:** The app is open at 5:59 PM (afternoon)
**When:** The time changes to 6:00 PM (evening)
**Then:** data-time attribute updates to "evening" within 30 minutes
**And:** CSS variables transition smoothly (no flash)

### Scenario: getTimeOfDay returns correct period

**Given:** I import getTimeOfDay from utils/time.js
**When:** I call getTimeOfDay() with hour 8
**Then:** It returns "morning"
**When:** I call getTimeOfDay() with hour 14
**Then:** It returns "afternoon"
**When:** I call getTimeOfDay() with hour 19
**Then:** It returns "evening"
**When:** I call getTimeOfDay() with hour 23
**Then:** It returns "night"

---

## Edge Cases

### Scenario: Boundary hour - morning to afternoon

**Given:** The current time is 11:59 AM
**When:** getTimeOfDay() is called
**Then:** Returns "morning"
**When:** Time becomes 12:00 PM
**Then:** Returns "afternoon"

### Scenario: Boundary hour - evening to night

**Given:** The current time is 8:59 PM
**When:** getTimeOfDay() is called
**Then:** Returns "evening"
**When:** Time becomes 9:00 PM
**Then:** Returns "night"

### Scenario: Midnight handling

**Given:** The current time is 12:00 AM (midnight)
**When:** getTimeOfDay() is called
**Then:** Returns "night" (not undefined or error)

---

## Non-Functional Tests

### Performance

| Metric | Target | Test Method |
|--------|--------|-------------|
| getTimeOfDay execution | < 1ms | performance.now() measurement |
| CSS variable update | < 16ms | No visible frame drop |
| Theme refresh interval | Every 30min | setInterval verification |

### Accessibility

| Check | Tool | Pass Criteria |
|-------|------|---------------|
| Color contrast (morning) | axe-core | All text 4.5:1 ratio |
| Color contrast (afternoon) | axe-core | All text 4.5:1 ratio |
| Color contrast (evening) | axe-core | All text 4.5:1 ratio |
| Color contrast (night) | axe-core | All text 4.5:1 ratio |

---

## Unit Test Implementation

```javascript
// src/utils/__tests__/time.test.js
import { describe, it, expect, vi } from 'vitest'
import { getTimeOfDay } from '../time'

describe('getTimeOfDay', () => {
  it('returns morning for hours 6-11', () => {
    expect(getTimeOfDay(6)).toBe('morning')
    expect(getTimeOfDay(8)).toBe('morning')
    expect(getTimeOfDay(11)).toBe('morning')
  })

  it('returns afternoon for hours 12-16', () => {
    expect(getTimeOfDay(12)).toBe('afternoon')
    expect(getTimeOfDay(14)).toBe('afternoon')
    expect(getTimeOfDay(16)).toBe('afternoon')
  })

  it('returns evening for hours 17-20', () => {
    expect(getTimeOfDay(17)).toBe('evening')
    expect(getTimeOfDay(19)).toBe('evening')
    expect(getTimeOfDay(20)).toBe('evening')
  })

  it('returns night for hours 21-5', () => {
    expect(getTimeOfDay(21)).toBe('night')
    expect(getTimeOfDay(0)).toBe('night')
    expect(getTimeOfDay(5)).toBe('night')
  })
})
```

---

## Integration Test Implementation

```javascript
// src/components/__tests__/App.theme.test.jsx
import { render } from '@testing-library/preact'
import { App } from '../App'

describe('Time-of-day theming', () => {
  beforeEach(() => {
    vi.useFakeTimers()
  })

  afterEach(() => {
    vi.useRealTimers()
  })

  it('sets morning theme at 8am', () => {
    vi.setSystemTime(new Date(2025, 0, 17, 8, 0))
    render(<App />)
    expect(document.documentElement.dataset.time).toBe('morning')
  })

  it('sets evening theme at 7pm', () => {
    vi.setSystemTime(new Date(2025, 0, 17, 19, 0))
    render(<App />)
    expect(document.documentElement.dataset.time).toBe('evening')
  })
})
```

# Tests: Rothko Gradient Backgrounds id: T-002 spec: S-002 (specs/02-rothko-backgrounds.md) --- ## Functional Tests ### Scenario: Progress card has gradient background **Given:** The app is loaded **When:** I inspect .progress-card element **Then:** background-image contains "linear-gradient" **And:** Gradient includes sage and cream color values **And:** Gradient has soft transition (no hard edges) ### Scenario: Header has gradient background **Given:** The app is loaded **When:** I inspect .header element **Then:** background-image contains "linear-gradient" **And:** Gradient creates luminous depth effect ### Scenario: Gradient breathing animation exists **Given:** The app is loaded **When:** I inspect .progress-card computed styles **Then:** animation property includes "gradient-breathe" **And:** animation-duration is approximately 20s **And:** animation-iteration-count is infinite ### Scenario: Gradients respect time of day **Given:** The app is loaded at evening time **When:** I inspect .progress-card background **Then:** Gradient includes warmer evening tones **And:** Colors shift toward golden/amber palette --- ## Visual Tests ### Scenario: No hard color bands visible **Given:** The app is rendered **When:** I visually inspect the progress card **Then:** Color transitions appear smooth and continuous **And:** No visible "banding" artifacts **And:** Effect resembles Rothko color field painting ### Scenario: Layered gradient depth **Given:** The app is rendered **When:** I inspect the background visually **Then:** Multiple gradient layers create depth **And:** Colors appear to glow from within **And:** Background doesn't compete with foreground content --- ## Edge Cases ### Scenario: High contrast mode compatibility **Given:** User has prefers-contrast: more enabled **When:** The app loads **Then:** Gradients simplified or removed **And:** Solid backgrounds used instead **And:** Content remains readable ### Scenario: Print stylesheet **Given:** User prints the page **When:** Print preview renders **Then:** Gradients don't print (saves ink) **And:** Solid light background used --- ## Non-Functional Tests ### Performance | Metric | Target | Test Method | |--------|--------|-------------| | Gradient paint time | < 16ms | Chrome DevTools Performance | | Animation frame rate | 60fps | No jank during breathing | | GPU memory | < 10MB | Chrome Task Manager | ### Accessibility | Check | Tool | Pass Criteria | |-------|------|---------------| | Text over gradient | Manual | All text readable | | Focus indicators | axe-core | Visible on gradient bg | --- ## CSS Test Implementation ```javascript // src/__tests__/styles.test.js import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest' describe('Rothko backgrounds', () => { beforeEach(() => { document.body.innerHTML = '
' // Load styles }) it('progress-card has gradient background', () => { const card = document.querySelector('.progress-card') const styles = getComputedStyle(card) expect(styles.backgroundImage).toContain('gradient') }) it('gradient animation is defined', () => { const card = document.querySelector('.progress-card') const styles = getComputedStyle(card) expect(styles.animationName).toBe('gradient-breathe') expect(styles.animationDuration).toBe('20s') }) }) ``` --- ## Visual Regression Test ```javascript // Using Playwright or Cypress describe('Rothko backgrounds visual', () => { it('progress card matches snapshot', async () => { await page.goto('/') const card = await page.$('.progress-card') expect(await card.screenshot()).toMatchSnapshot('rothko-progress-card.png') }) }) ```

# Tests: Agnes Martin Spacing System

id: T-003
spec: S-003 (specs/03-agnes-martin-spacing.md)

---

## Functional Tests

### Scenario: Space tokens are defined

**Given:** The styles.css is loaded
**When:** I inspect :root CSS variables
**Then:** --space-1 equals 4px (0.25rem)
**And:** --space-2 equals 8px (0.5rem)
**And:** --space-3 equals 12px (0.75rem)
**And:** --space-4 equals 16px (1rem)
**And:** --space-6 equals 24px (1.5rem)
**And:** --space-8 equals 32px (2rem)
**And:** --space-12 equals 48px (3rem)

### Scenario: Components use space tokens

**Given:** The app is loaded
**When:** I inspect .entry-card padding
**Then:** padding uses var(--space-N) tokens
**And:** No hardcoded pixel values for spacing

### Scenario: Consistent vertical rhythm

**Given:** Multiple entry cards are displayed
**When:** I measure gaps between cards
**Then:** All gaps are multiples of 8px
**And:** Spacing feels rhythmic and consistent

### Scenario: Grid pattern overlay (optional)

**Given:** The .agnes-grid class is applied to body
**When:** I inspect the background
**Then:** Subtle grid lines visible at 0.03 opacity
**And:** Grid aligns to 8px intervals

---

## Edge Cases

### Scenario: No spacing collisions

**Given:** Multiple spacing rules apply to an element
**When:** Styles cascade
**Then:** No unexpected spacing additions
**And:** Margins don't collapse unexpectedly

### Scenario: Responsive spacing

**Given:** The viewport is mobile width (320px)
**When:** I inspect component spacing
**Then:** Spacing remains proportional
**And:** Touch targets maintain adequate size

---

## Audit Tests

### Scenario: No hardcoded spacing values

**Given:** I search styles.css for spacing patterns
**When:** I grep for "padding:|margin:|gap:" followed by px values
**Then:** Zero matches found (all use tokens)
**And:** Only var(--space-N) used for spacing

### Scenario: Consistent component spacing

**Given:** I audit DailyProgress.jsx styles
**When:** I check all spacing declarations
**Then:** All use --space-N tokens
**And:** Same audit passes for EntryList, EntryForm, Header

---

## Non-Functional Tests

### Performance

| Metric | Target | Test Method |
|--------|--------|-------------|
| CSS variable resolution | < 1ms | No perf impact from tokens |
| Grid overlay render | < 5ms | Optional feature |

### Accessibility

| Check | Tool | Pass Criteria |
|-------|------|---------------|
| Touch targets | Manual | All buttons  44px |
| Content spacing | Manual | Readable line spacing |

---

## Unit Test Implementation

```javascript
// src/__tests__/spacing.test.js
import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest'

describe('Agnes Martin spacing system', () => {
  beforeEach(() => {
    // Load styles into JSDOM
  })

  it('defines all space tokens', () => {
    const root = document.documentElement
    const styles = getComputedStyle(root)

    expect(styles.getPropertyValue('--space-1').trim()).toBe('0.25rem')
    expect(styles.getPropertyValue('--space-2').trim()).toBe('0.5rem')
    expect(styles.getPropertyValue('--space-3').trim()).toBe('0.75rem')
    expect(styles.getPropertyValue('--space-4').trim()).toBe('1rem')
    expect(styles.getPropertyValue('--space-6').trim()).toBe('1.5rem')
    expect(styles.getPropertyValue('--space-8').trim()).toBe('2rem')
    expect(styles.getPropertyValue('--space-12').trim()).toBe('3rem')
  })

  it('space tokens follow 8px grid', () => {
    const root = document.documentElement
    const styles = getComputedStyle(root)

    // Convert rem to px (assuming 16px base)
    const space2 = parseFloat(styles.getPropertyValue('--space-2')) * 16
    const space4 = parseFloat(styles.getPropertyValue('--space-4')) * 16
    const space8 = parseFloat(styles.getPropertyValue('--space-8')) * 16

    expect(space2).toBe(8)
    expect(space4).toBe(16)
    expect(space8).toBe(32)
  })
})
```

---

## CSS Audit Script

```javascript
// scripts/audit-spacing.js
const fs = require('fs')
const css = fs.readFileSync('src/styles.css', 'utf8')

// Find hardcoded spacing
const hardcodedPattern = /(padding|margin|gap):\s*\d+px/g
const matches = css.match(hardcodedPattern)

if (matches && matches.length > 0) {
  console.error('Found hardcoded spacing values:')
  matches.forEach(m => console.error(`  - ${m}`))
  process.exit(1)
} else {
  console.log(' All spacing uses tokens')
}
```

---

## CSS Audit Script

```javascript
// scripts/audit-spacing.js
const fs = require('fs')
const css = fs.readFileSync('src/styles.css', 'utf8')

// Find hardcoded spacing
const hardcodedPattern = /(padding|margin|gap):\s*\d+px/g
const matches = css.match(hardcodedPattern)

if (matches && matches.length > 0) {
  console.error('Found hardcoded spacing values:')
  matches.forEach(m => console.error(`  - ${m}`))
  process.exit(1)
} else {
  console.log(' All spacing uses tokens')
}
```

# Tests: Frankenthaler Soft-Edge Progress

id: T-004
spec: S-004 (specs/04-frankenthaler-progress.md)

---

## Functional Tests

### Scenario: SVG filter definitions exist

**Given:** DailyProgress component is rendered
**When:** I inspect the SVG element
**Then:** A <defs> section contains filter definitions
**And:** Filter includes feGaussianBlur element
**And:** Filter has unique id for reference

### Scenario: Progress ring uses blur filter

**Given:** DailyProgress component is rendered
**When:** I inspect .progress-ring-fill element
**Then:** filter attribute references the blur filter
**And:** Edges appear soft, not crisp

### Scenario: Gradient fill on progress ring

**Given:** Progress is at 50%
**When:** I inspect the progress ring stroke
**Then:** stroke references a gradient definition
**And:** Gradient has soft color stops (not abrupt)

### Scenario: Organic edge variation

**Given:** DailyProgress component is rendered
**When:** I inspect the SVG filters
**Then:** feTurbulence element adds organic variation
**And:** Edges have subtle irregularity (watercolor effect)

---

## Edge Cases

### Scenario: Reduced motion removes blur animation

**Given:** User has prefers-reduced-motion enabled
**When:** The component renders
**Then:** Blur filter still applies (static)
**And:** No animated filter transitions
**And:** Solid fill alternative available

### Scenario: Zero progress state

**Given:** No entries logged today
**When:** Progress is 0%
**Then:** Ring shows empty state
**And:** No blur artifacts on empty ring

### Scenario: Over 100% progress

**Given:** User exceeds calorie goal
**When:** Progress is 115%
**Then:** Ring shows full with overflow indicator
**And:** Blur effect still applies correctly

---

## Non-Functional Tests

### Performance

| Metric | Target | Test Method |
|--------|--------|-------------|
| SVG filter render | < 10ms | DevTools Performance |
| Filter not causing repaints | 0 repaints on scroll | Paint flashing |
| GPU acceleration | Used | will-change hint |

### Accessibility

| Check | Tool | Pass Criteria |
|-------|------|---------------|
| Progress ring ARIA | axe-core | role="progressbar" present |
| Blur doesn't hide info | Manual | Numbers still readable |

---

## Unit Test Implementation

```javascript
// src/components/__tests__/DailyProgress.filter.test.jsx
import { render } from '@testing-library/preact'
import { DailyProgress } from '../DailyProgress'

describe('Frankenthaler soft-edge progress', () => {
  it('renders SVG filter definitions', () => {
    const { container } = render(
      <DailyProgress entries={[]} goals={{ calories: 2000 }} />
    )

    const defs = container.querySelector('svg defs')
    expect(defs).toBeTruthy()

    const filter = defs.querySelector('filter')
    expect(filter).toBeTruthy()
    expect(filter.id).toBeTruthy()
  })

  it('filter includes Gaussian blur', () => {
    const { container } = render(
      <DailyProgress entries={[]} goals={{ calories: 2000 }} />
    )

    const blur = container.querySelector('feGaussianBlur')
    expect(blur).toBeTruthy()
    expect(blur.getAttribute('stdDeviation')).toBeTruthy()
  })

  it('progress ring references filter', () => {
    const { container } = render(
      <DailyProgress
        entries={[{ calories: 1000, protein: 50, carbs: 100, fat: 30 }]}
        goals={{ calories: 2000 }}
      />
    )

    const fill = container.querySelector('.progress-ring-fill')
    expect(fill.getAttribute('filter')).toContain('url(#')
  })

  it('includes gradient definition', () => {
    const { container } = render(
      <DailyProgress entries={[]} goals={{ calories: 2000 }} />
    )

    const gradient = container.querySelector('linearGradient, radialGradient')
    expect(gradient).toBeTruthy()
  })
})
```

---

## Visual Test

```javascript
// e2e/frankenthaler.spec.js
test('progress ring has soft edges', async ({ page }) => {
  await page.goto('/')
  // Add entry to show progress
  await page.click('[data-testid="fab"]')
  await page.fill('[name="calories"]', '1000')
  await page.click('[type="submit"]')

  const ring = page.locator('.progress-ring-fill')
  await expect(ring).toHaveScreenshot('frankenthaler-ring.png')
})
```

# Tests: Meal Category Organization

id: T-011
spec: S-011 (specs/11-meal-categories.md)

---

## Functional Tests

### Scenario: getSuggestedMealType returns correct type

**Given:** Current time is 8:00 AM
**When:** getSuggestedMealType() is called
**Then:** Returns "breakfast"

**Given:** Current time is 1:00 PM
**When:** getSuggestedMealType() is called
**Then:** Returns "lunch"

**Given:** Current time is 7:00 PM
**When:** getSuggestedMealType() is called
**Then:** Returns "dinner"

**Given:** Current time is 3:00 PM
**When:** getSuggestedMealType() is called
**Then:** Returns "snack"

### Scenario: Entry form shows meal type selector

**Given:** Entry form is open
**When:** I inspect the form
**Then:** 4 meal type buttons visible (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Snacks)
**And:** Current suggested meal type is pre-selected

### Scenario: User can override suggested meal type

**Given:** Form suggests "lunch" at 1pm
**When:** User clicks "breakfast" button
**Then:** Breakfast becomes selected
**And:** Entry saves with mealType: "breakfast"

### Scenario: Entries grouped by meal type

**Given:** 5 entries exist: 2 breakfast, 2 lunch, 1 snack
**When:** EntryList renders
**Then:** 3 groups visible (Breakfast, Lunch, Snacks)
**And:** Dinner group not shown (no entries)
**And:** Each group shows calorie subtotal

---

## Edge Cases

### Scenario: Existing entries without mealType

**Given:** Entries exist from before migration
**When:** App loads
**Then:** Entries without mealType default to "snack"
**And:** Appear in Snacks group

### Scenario: All entries same meal type

**Given:** All 5 entries are breakfast
**When:** EntryList renders
**Then:** Only Breakfast group shown
**And:** No empty group headers

---

## Unit Test Implementation

```javascript
// src/utils/__tests__/meals.test.js
import { getSuggestedMealType, MEAL_TYPES, groupByMealType } from '../meals'

describe('getSuggestedMealType', () => {
  it('returns breakfast for morning hours', () => {
    expect(getSuggestedMealType(7)).toBe('breakfast')
    expect(getSuggestedMealType(10)).toBe('breakfast')
  })

  it('returns lunch for midday hours', () => {
    expect(getSuggestedMealType(12)).toBe('lunch')
    expect(getSuggestedMealType(14)).toBe('lunch')
  })

  it('returns dinner for evening hours', () => {
    expect(getSuggestedMealType(18)).toBe('dinner')
    expect(getSuggestedMealType(20)).toBe('dinner')
  })

  it('returns snack for in-between hours', () => {
    expect(getSuggestedMealType(15)).toBe('snack')
    expect(getSuggestedMealType(22)).toBe('snack')
  })
})

describe('groupByMealType', () => {
  const entries = [
    { id: 1, mealType: 'breakfast', calories: 300 },
    { id: 2, mealType: 'breakfast', calories: 200 },
    { id: 3, mealType: 'lunch', calories: 600 },
    { id: 4, mealType: 'snack', calories: 150 },
  ]

  it('groups entries correctly', () => {
    const grouped = groupByMealType(entries)
    expect(grouped.breakfast.length).toBe(2)
    expect(grouped.lunch.length).toBe(1)
    expect(grouped.snack.length).toBe(1)
    expect(grouped.dinner).toBeUndefined()
  })
})
```

---

## Component Tests

```javascript
// src/components/__tests__/EntryForm.mealType.test.jsx
import { render, fireEvent } from '@testing-library/preact'
import { EntryForm } from '../EntryForm'

describe('EntryForm meal type selector', () => {
  it('renders all 4 meal type buttons', () => {
    const { getByText } = render(<EntryForm onSubmit={() => {}} />)
    expect(getByText('Breakfast')).toBeTruthy()
    expect(getByText('Lunch')).toBeTruthy()
    expect(getByText('Dinner')).toBeTruthy()
    expect(getByText('Snacks')).toBeTruthy()
  })

  it('pre-selects suggested meal type', () => {
    vi.setSystemTime(new Date(2025, 0, 17, 8, 0)) // 8am
    const { container } = render(<EntryForm onSubmit={() => {}} />)
    const activeBtn = container.querySelector('.meal-type-btn.active')
    expect(activeBtn.textContent).toContain('Breakfast')
  })

  it('allows changing meal type', () => {
    const onSubmit = vi.fn()
    const { getByText, getByLabelText } = render(<EntryForm onSubmit={onSubmit} />)

    fireEvent.click(getByText('Dinner'))
    fireEvent.change(getByLabelText(/calories/i), { target: { value: '500' } })
    fireEvent.submit(document.querySelector('form'))

    expect(onSubmit).toHaveBeenCalledWith(
      expect.objectContaining({ mealType: 'dinner' })
    )
  })
})
```

Per /design Phase 8.5, each test file was checked for:

1. **False Positive Detection**  Could test pass if feature is broken?
2. **False Negative Detection**  Any tests too strict or flaky?
3. **Spec Coverage**  Does every requirement have a test?
4. **Mutation Survival**  Would test catch common bugs?
5. **Inversion Test**  Do tests fail when code breaks?

---

file.content:
# Spec: Time-of-Day Theming

**Phase:** 1 - Atmosphere & Perception
**Artist Influence:** James Turrell (Skyspaces, perceptual light shifts)
**Priority:** High
**Estimated Effort:** Medium

---

## Overview

Implement a time-of-day theming system inspired by James Turrell's light installations. The app should gradually shift its color perception throughout the day  not jarring mode switches, but subtle perceptual transitions that make morning feel warm and evening feel calm.

## Artist Context

James Turrell creates "Skyspaces"  rooms with apertures to the sky where viewers experience light changing over time. The key insight: **light affects how we feel**, not just what we see. Our app should embody this  the 7am experience should *feel* different from 7pm.

## Requirements

### Time Periods

| Period | Hours | Emotional Goal | Color Shift |
|--------|-------|----------------|-------------|
| Morning | 5am - 11am | Warm, energizing, fresh start | Warmer creams, peachy undertones |
| Midday | 11am - 4pm | Clear, focused, productive | Neutral, current palette |
| Evening | 4pm - 8pm | Calm, winding down | Cooler sage, softer contrast |
| Night | 8pm - 5am | Restful, low stimulation | Dark mode, muted colors |

### Implementation

1. **CSS Custom Properties:** All colors must use CSS variables that can be swapped
2. **Smooth Transitions:** Colors transition over ~30 minutes, not instant switches
3. **JavaScript Time Detection:** Check system time, apply appropriate theme class
4. **No User Toggle (yet):** Automatic only  manual override is Phase 6

### CSS Variables to Create

```css
/* Morning overrides */
.theme-morning {
  --color-cream: #FDF8F3;      /* Warmer */
  --color-sage: #6B7A62;       /* Slightly warmer green */
  --color-terracotta: #D4896B; /* More peachy */
}

/* Evening overrides */
.theme-evening {
  --color-cream: #F5F5F0;      /* Cooler */
  --color-sage: #5A6B58;       /* Cooler green */
  --color-terracotta: #B8776A; /* Muted coral */
}

/* Night overrides */
.theme-night {
  --color-cream: #1A1A1A;      /* Dark background */
  --color-white: #242424;      /* Dark surface */
  --color-sage: #8A9A82;       /* Lighter for contrast */
  --color-espresso: #E8E8E8;   /* Light text */
  /* ... full dark mode palette */
}
```

### JavaScript Logic

```javascript
// src/utils/theme.js
export function getTimeOfDay() {
  const hour = new Date().getHours()
  if (hour >= 5 && hour < 11) return 'morning'
  if (hour >= 11 && hour < 16) return 'midday'
  if (hour >= 16 && hour < 20) return 'evening'
  return 'night'
}

export function applyTheme() {
  const period = getTimeOfDay()
  document.body.className = `theme-${period}`
}

// Call on app load and every 15 minutes
```

### App.jsx Integration

```javascript
import { useEffect } from 'preact/hooks'
import { applyTheme } from '../utils/theme'

export function App() {
  useEffect(() => {
    applyTheme()
    const interval = setInterval(applyTheme, 15 * 60 * 1000) // Check every 15min
    return () => clearInterval(interval)
  }, [])

  // ... rest of component
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] App detects current time and applies appropriate theme class
- [ ] Morning (5-11am) has warmer, peachy undertones
- [ ] Midday (11am-4pm) uses default palette
- [ ] Evening (4-8pm) has cooler, calmer tones
- [ ] Night (8pm-5am) activates full dark mode
- [ ] Theme checks every 15 minutes for gradual transitions
- [ ] All existing UI elements work correctly in all themes
- [ ] Contrast ratios maintain accessibility (4.5:1 minimum)

## Files to Modify

- `src/styles.css`  Add theme variant classes
- `src/utils/theme.js`  Create (new file)
- `src/components/App.jsx`  Add theme effect

## Test Plan

1. Manually set system time to 7am  verify morning theme
2. Set time to 2pm  verify midday theme
3. Set time to 6pm  verify evening theme
4. Set time to 10pm  verify night theme
5. Run Lighthouse accessibility check on all themes

## Notes

- Night mode is critical for family use (checking before bed)
- Turrell's work emphasizes gradual perception shifts  avoid jarring changes
- Future: Add sunrise/sunset API for location-aware timing

content.content:
1# Spec: Streak Tracking Core Logic
     2
     3**Phase:** 5 - Gamification & Insights
     4**Priority:** High
     5**Estimated Effort:** Medium
     6
     7---
     8
     9## Overview
    10
    11Comprehensive streak tracking system that tracks consecutive days of hitting calorie goals. Handles edge cases like timezone changes, missed days, and partial goal achievement.
    12
    13## Requirements
    14
    15### Streak Rules
    16
    171. **Day Counts as Success** when:
    18   - Calories are within range: `goal * 0.9 <= actual <= goal * 1.1`
    19   - At least one entry logged that day
    20
    212. **Streak Continues** when:
    22   - Yesterday was successful AND today is successful
    23   - OR today is in progress (not yet midnight)
    24
    253. **Streak Breaks** when:
    26   - A day passes with no entries
    27   - A day ends outside calorie range
    28
    29### Data Model
    30
    31```javascript
    32// src/utils/streaks.js
    33
    34// Stored in localStorage: streak-{profileId}
    35const STREAK_SCHEMA = {
    36  current: 0,           // Current streak count
    37  longest: 0,           // All-time longest streak
    38  lastSuccessDate: null, // ISO date string of last successful day
    39  history: [],          // Last 30 days of success/fail
    40  weeklyGoal: 5,        // Days per week target (optional)
    41  weeklyProgress: 0     // Days hit this week
    42}
    43
    44// History entry
    45{
    46  date: "2025-01-17",
    47  success: true,
    48  calories: 2150,
    49  goal: 2200,
    50  ratio: 0.98
    51}
    52```
    53
    54### Core Functions
    55
    56```javascript
    57export function getStreakData(profileId) {
    58  const key = profileId ? `streak-${profileId}` : 'streak'
    59  const stored = localStorage.getItem(key)
    60  return stored ? JSON.parse(stored) : {
    61    current: 0,
    62    longest: 0,
    63    lastSuccessDate: null,
    64    history: [],
    65    weeklyGoal: 5,
    66    weeklyProgress: 0
    67  }
    68}
    69
    70export function saveStreakData(profileId, data) {
    71  const key = profileId ? `streak-${profileId}` : 'streak'
    72  localStorage.setItem(key, JSON.stringify(data))
    73}
    74
    75export function isSuccessfulDay(calories, goal) {
    76  if (!goal || goal === 0) return false
    77  const ratio = calories / goal
    78  return ratio >= 0.9 && ratio <= 1.1
    79}
    80
    81export function updateStreakForDay(profileId, date, calories, goal) {
    82  const data = getStreakData(profileId)
    83  const success = isSuccessfulDay(calories, goal)
    84  const today = formatDate(new Date())
    85  const yesterday = formatDate(getYesterday(new Date()))
    86
    87  // Update history
    88  const existingIndex = data.history.findIndex(h => h.date === date)
    89  const historyEntry = {
    90    date,
    91    success,
    92    calories,
    93    goal,
    94    ratio: goal ? calories / goal : 0
    95  }
    96
    97  if (existingIndex >= 0) {
    98    data.history[existingIndex] = historyEntry
    99  } else {
   100    data.history.push(historyEntry)
   101  }
   102
   103  // Keep only last 30 days
   104  data.history = data.history
   105    .sort((a, b) => new Date(b.date) - new Date(a.date))
   106    .slice(0, 30)
   107
   108  // Update streak
   109  if (date === today && success) {
   110    if (data.lastSuccessDate === yesterday) {
   111      // Continuing streak
   112      data.current++
   113    } else if (data.lastSuccessDate !== today) {
   114      // Starting new streak
   115      data.current = 1
   116    }
   117    data.lastSuccessDate = today
   118    data.longest = Math.max(data.longest, data.current)
   119  } else if (date === today && !success && data.lastSuccessDate !== today) {
   120    // Check if streak should break (day ended without success)
   121    // This is called at end of day or on new day load
   122    if (data.lastSuccessDate !== yesterday && data.lastSuccessDate !== today) {
   123      data.current = 0
   124    }
   125  }
   126
   127  // Update weekly progress
   128  data.weeklyProgress = calculateWeeklyProgress(data.history)
   129
   130  saveStreakData(profileId, data)
   131  return data
   132}
   133
   134function calculateWeeklyProgress(history) {
   135  const startOfWeek = getStartOfWeek(new Date())
   136  return history.filter(h =>
   137    h.success && new Date(h.date) >= startOfWeek
   138  ).length
   139}
   140
   141function getStartOfWeek(date) {
   142  const d = new Date(date)
   143  const day = d.getDay()
   144  const diff = d.getDate() - day + (day === 0 ? -6 : 1) // Monday start
   145  d.setDate(diff)
   146  d.setHours(0, 0, 0, 0)
   147  return d
   148}
   149
   150function getYesterday(date) {
   151  const d = new Date(date)
   152  d.setDate(d.getDate() - 1)
   153  return d
   154}
   155```
   156
   157### Streak Check on App Load
   158
   159```javascript
   160// In App.jsx or useEffect
   161export function checkAndUpdateStreak(profileId, entries, goals) {
   162  const today = formatDate(new Date())
   163  const todayEntries = entries.filter(e => e.date === today)
   164
   165  if (todayEntries.length > 0) {
   166    const totals = calculateTotals(todayEntries)
   167    updateStreakForDay(profileId, today, totals.calories, goals.calories)
   168  }
   169
   170  // Check if streak broke due to missed yesterday
   171  const data = getStreakData(profileId)
   172  const yesterday = formatDate(getYesterday(new Date()))
   173
   174  if (data.lastSuccessDate &&
   175      data.lastSuccessDate !== today &&
   176      data.lastSuccessDate !== yesterday) {
   177    // Streak is broken
   178    data.current = 0
   179    saveStreakData(profileId, data)
   180  }
   181
   182  return getStreakData(profileId)
   183}
   184```
   185
   186### Streak Freeze (Future Feature)
   187
   188```javascript
   189// Allow one "freeze" per week to protect streak
   190export function useStreakFreeze(profileId, date) {
   191  const data = getStreakData(profileId)
   192
   193  if (data.freezesAvailable > 0) {
   194    data.freezesAvailable--
   195    data.frozenDates.push(date)
   196    // Frozen day counts as neutral (doesn't break or extend)
   197    saveStreakData(profileId, data)
   198    return true
   199  }
   200  return false
   201}
   202```
   203
   204### Recalculate Streak
   205
   206For data recovery or migration:
   207
   208```javascript
   209export function recalculateStreak(profileId, allEntries, goals) {
   210  // Sort entries by date
   211  const byDate = new Map()
   212  for (const entry of allEntries) {
   213    if (!byDate.has(entry.date)) {
   214      byDate.set(entry.date, [])
   215    }
   216    byDate.get(entry.date).push(entry)
   217  }
   218
   219  // Calculate totals per day
   220  const dailyTotals = []
   221  for (const [date, entries] of byDate) {
   222    const totals = calculateTotals(entries)
   223    dailyTotals.push({
   224      date,
   225      success: isSuccessfulDay(totals.calories, goals.calories),
   226      calories: totals.calories,
   227      goal: goals.calories
   228    })
   229  }
   230
   231  // Sort by date ascending
   232  dailyTotals.sort((a, b) => new Date(a.date) - new Date(b.date))
   233
   234  // Calculate streaks
   235  let current = 0
   236  let longest = 0
   237  let lastSuccess = null
   238
   239  for (const day of dailyTotals) {
   240    if (day.success) {
   241      if (lastSuccess) {
   242        const lastDate = new Date(lastSuccess)
   243        const thisDate = new Date(day.date)
   244        const diffDays = Math.round((thisDate - lastDate) / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24))
   245
   246        if (diffDays === 1) {
   247          current++
   248        } else {
   249          current = 1
   250        }
   251      } else {
   252        current = 1
   253      }
   254      lastSuccess = day.date
   255      longest = Math.max(longest, current)
   256    }
   257  }
   258
   259  return {
   260    current,
   261    longest,
   262    lastSuccessDate: lastSuccess,
   263    history: dailyTotals.slice(-30)
   264  }
   265}
   266```
   267
   268## Acceptance Criteria
   269
   270- [ ] Streak increments when goal hit (90-110% range)
   271- [ ] Streak resets when day missed
   272- [ ] Streak persists across sessions
   273- [ ] Longest streak tracked separately
   274- [ ] Last 30 days history stored
   275- [ ] Weekly progress calculated (Mon-Sun)
   276- [ ] Streak recalculation works for data recovery
   277- [ ] Per-profile streak data
   278
   279## Files to Create/Modify
   280
   281- `src/utils/streaks.js`  Create (core logic)
   282- `src/utils/storage.js`  Add streak storage helpers
   283- `src/components/App.jsx`  Call streak check on load
   284- `src/hooks/useStreak.js`  Optional: reactive hook
   285
   286## Test Plan
   287
   2881. Add entries hitting goal  streak = 1?
   2892. Next day hit goal  streak = 2?
   2903. Miss a day  streak resets?
   2914. Reload app  streak persists?
   2925. Hit 100% exactly  counts as success?
   2936. Hit 89%  doesn't count?
   2947. Hit 111%  doesn't count?
   2958. Recalculate from entries  correct streak?
   296
   297## Edge Cases
   298
   299- Timezone change mid-streak
   300- User changes goal mid-streak
   301- Entries deleted after day ended
   302- Multiple profiles with separate streaks
   303- App not opened for several days
   304

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

content.thinking:
Now I'll actually stress test these specs. Let me apply the checks from the /design skill:

**Spec Validation Checks (Phase 7.5):**
1. Ambiguity Detection - Can any requirement be interpreted two ways?
2. Edge Case Generation - Boundary conditions covered?
3. Implementation Simulation - Walk through as a developer
4. Contradiction Detection - Any conflicting requirements?

Let me analyze each spec critically.

## S-001: Time-of-Day Theming

**Ambiguity Issues Found:**
1.  The table says "Morning 5am-11am" but code says `hour >= 5 && hour < 11`  **Contradiction**: 11am is included in table but excluded in code (hour < 11)
2.  The table says "Midday 11am-4pm" but code says `hour >= 11 && hour < 16`  4pm is 16:00, so `< 16` means 3:59pm is last midday minute. The table says "4pm" is boundary  **Ambiguous**: is 4pm midday or evening?
3.  "Smooth transitions over ~30 minutes" but code says `setInterval(applyTheme, 15 * 60 * 1000)`  **Contradiction**: checking every 15 min isn't a smooth transition, it's a discrete check
4.  No CSS transition property defined for the smooth transition

**Edge Cases Missing:**
- What if user crosses midnight while using app?
- What if system time is wrong?
- What about timezones / travel?

**Contradictions:**
- Acceptance criteria says "checks every 15 minutes" but requirements say "30 minutes smooth transitions"

## S-007: Kusama Celebration

**Ambiguity Issues Found:**
1.  Trigger condition says `totals.calories >= goals.calories` but doesn't specify what happens if goal is 0 or null


2.  The date format for `localStorage.getItem(`celebrated-${currentDate}`)` is unclear  ISO string? YYYY-MM-DD? This affects storage key consistency.
3.  Storage key doesn't include profileId, so multiple profiles on the same device would share celebration state  **Missing profile scoping**

**Edge Cases Missing:**
- What if goal changes mid-day after celebration?
- What if entries are deleted to go back under goal?
- What happens with multiple profiles on same day?

**Contradictions:**
- Spec 09 says celebration should accept a `variant` prop, but this spec doesn't define the prop interface

## S-015

Streak tracking has several unresolved issues. The condition "Streak Continues when... OR today is in progress (not yet midnight)" isn't actually checked in the code. Functions like `formatDate` and `calculateTotals` are referenced but never defined. There's a type mismatch where `getYesterday(new Date())` returns a Date object but gets compared as a string to `data.lastSuccessDate`. Weekly progress assumes Monday as the start day without documenting this requirement. DST transitions could cause days to be 23 or 25 hours, future-dated entries aren't handled, and there's a potential race condition when checking streak status.

The freeze feature references `data.freezesAvailable` and `data.frozenDates` that don't exist in the schema, creating a disconnect between the intended functionality and what's actually defined.

input.content:
# Stress Test Findings

**Date:** 2026-01-17
**Method:** Applied /design Phase 7.5 & 8.5 validation checks manually

---

## SPEC ISSUES FOUND

### S-001: Time-of-Day Theming  4 ISSUES

#### Issue 1:  CONTRADICTION  Hour boundaries don't match

**Table says:**
| Period | Hours |
|--------|-------|
| Morning | 5am - 11am |
| Midday | 11am - 4pm |

**Code says:**
```javascript
if (hour >= 5 && hour < 11) return 'morning'   // 11 excluded
if (hour >= 11 && hour < 16) return 'midday'   // 4pm (16) excluded
```

**Problem:** At 11:00am, table implies morning but code returns midday.

**Fix needed:** Clarify: is 11:00 morning or midday? Update either table or code.

---

#### Issue 2:  CONTRADICTION  Transition timing

**Requirements say:** "Colors transition over ~30 minutes, not instant switches"

**Code says:** `setInterval(applyTheme, 15 * 60 * 1000)`  checks every 15 min

**Problem:** Checking every 15 min creates discrete switches, not 30-minute transitions. No CSS `transition` property defined.

**Fix needed:** Add CSS `transition: background-color 1800s linear` or similar to create gradual shift, OR clarify this is discrete switching.

---

#### Issue 3:  MISSING  CSS transition property

**Problem:** Requirements mention "gradual transitions" but CSS doesn't include any `transition` property on the theme classes.

**Fix needed:** Add to spec:
```css
body {
  transition: background-color 900s linear,
              color 900s linear;
}
```

---

#### Issue 4:  MISSING  Edge cases

- What if user's system time is wrong?
- What about timezone travel?
- What if user crosses midnight while using app?

**Fix needed:** Add to Edge Cases section or explicitly descope.

---

### S-007: Kusama Celebration  4 ISSUES

#### Issue 1:  MISSING  Profile scoping in storage

**Code shows:**
```javascript
localStorage.getItem(`celebrated-${currentDate}`)
```

**Problem:** No profileId in key. If user switches profiles, celebration state is shared.

**Fix needed:** Change to `celebrated-${profileId}-${currentDate}`

---

#### Issue 2:  AMBIGUOUS  Date format not specified

**Code uses:** `celebrated-${currentDate}`

**Problem:** What format is currentDate? ISO string? YYYY-MM-DD? This affects storage key consistency.

**Fix needed:** Explicitly specify: "currentDate must be YYYY-MM-DD format from formatDate()"

---

#### Issue 3:  MISSING  Goal of 0 handling

**Trigger condition:**
```javascript
totals.calories >= goals.calories
```

**Problem:** If goal is 0 or undefined, this would trigger celebration at 0 calories.

**Fix needed:** Add guard: `goals.calories > 0 && totals.calories >= goals.calories`

---

#### Issue 4:  MISSING  Variant prop interface

**Spec 09 expects:** `<Celebration variant="epic" message="100 Days!" />`

**This spec defines:** `<Celebration onComplete={} />`  no variant prop

**Fix needed:** Add variant and message props to component interface, or note "variant support added in S-009"

---

### S-015: Streak Tracking Logic  5 ISSUES

#### Issue 1:  BUG  Type mismatch in date comparison

**Code:**
```javascript
const yesterday = formatDate(getYesterday(new Date()))
...
if (data.lastSuccessDate === yesterday)
```

**But getYesterday returns:**
```javascript
function getYesterday(date) {
  const d = new Date(date)
  d.setDate(d.getDate() - 1)
  return d  // Returns Date object, not string!
}
```

**Problem:** Comparing string `lastSuccessDate` to Date object `yesterday` will always be false.

**Fix needed:** Change to `return formatDate(d)` in getYesterday, or wrap call.

---

#### Issue 2:  MISSING  formatDate function not defined

**Code references:** `formatDate(new Date())`, `formatDate(getYesterday(...))`

**Problem:** formatDate is never defined in the spec.

**Fix needed:** Add definition:
```javascript
function formatDate(date) {
  return date.toISOString().split('T')[0] // "YYYY-MM-DD"
}
```

---

#### Issue 3:  MISSING  calculateTotals function not defined

**Code references:** `const totals = calculateTotals(todayEntries)`

**Problem:** Function not defined in spec.

**Fix needed:** Either import from existing utils or define inline.

---

#### Issue 4:  CONTRADICTION  Schema vs freeze feature

**Schema defined:**
```javascript
const STREAK_SCHEMA = {
  current, longest, lastSuccessDate, history, weeklyGoal, weeklyProgress
}
```

**Freeze feature uses:**
```javascript
data.freezesAvailable  // NOT IN SCHEMA
data.frozenDates       // NOT IN SCHEMA
```

**Fix needed:** Either add to schema or mark freeze as "Future - schema extension needed"

---

#### Issue 5:  AMBIGUOUS  "Today is in progress" not implemented

**Requirements say:** "Streak Continues when... OR today is in progress (not yet midnight)"

**Problem:** Code never checks if it's "not yet midnight"  this rule isn't implemented.

**Fix needed:** Clarify what "in progress" means and implement, or remove from requirements.

---

### S-008: Streak Visualization  1 ISSUE

#### Issue 1:  CONTRADICTION with S-015

**S-008 defines:**
```javascript
export function getStreakData(profileId) {
  return JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem(key) || '{"current": 0, "longest": 0, "lastDate": null}')
}
```

**S-015 defines:**
```javascript
export function getStreakData(profileId) {
  return stored ? JSON.parse(stored) : {
    current: 0, longest: 0, lastSuccessDate: null, history: [], weeklyGoal: 5, weeklyProgress: 0
  }
}
```

**Problems:**
1. S-008 uses `lastDate`, S-015 uses `lastSuccessDate`
2. Different default schemas
3. Both specs export same function name

**Fix needed:** Consolidate into one canonical definition in S-015, reference from S-008.

---

## TEST ISSUES FOUND

### T-001: Time-of-Day Theming

#### Issue 1:  FALSE NEGATIVE  Tests won't catch boundary bug

**Test says:**
```javascript
expect(getTimeOfDay(11)).toBe('morning')
```

**But spec code returns:** `'midday'` for hour 11

**Problem:** Test expects morning, code returns midday. Test will fail but for wrong reason  the spec itself is ambiguous.

**Fix needed:** Align test with clarified spec.

---

### T-007: Kusama Celebration

#### Issue 1:  MISSING  Profile isolation test

**Problem:** No test verifies celebration state is per-profile.

**Fix needed:** Add test:
```javascript
it('tracks celebration separately per profile', () => {
  // Profile A celebrates
  // Switch to Profile B
  // Should be able to celebrate
})
```

---

### T-015: Streak Tracking Logic

#### Issue 1:  WILL FAIL  Tests use non-existent functions

**Tests reference:** `formatDate()` which isn't in the spec

**Problem:** Tests will fail to compile/run.

**Fix needed:** Tests need to import or mock formatDate.

---

## SUMMARY

| Spec | Issues | Severity |
|------|--------|----------|
| S-001 | 4 | Medium |
| S-007 | 4 | Medium |
| S-008 | 1 | High (contradiction) |
| S-015 | 5 | High |
| Others | 0 |  |

**Total Issues Found: 14**

| Category | Count |
|----------|-------|
| Contradictions | 4 |
| Ambiguities | 3 |
| Missing definitions | 4 |
| Missing edge cases | 3 |

---

## RECOMMENDED FIXES

### Priority 1  Must fix before implementation

1. **S-015 + S-008:** Consolidate getStreakData, use consistent schema
2. **S-015:** Add formatDate definition
3. **S-015:** Fix getYesterday return type
4. **S-007:** Add profileId to localStorage key

### Priority 2  Should fix

5. **S-001:** Clarify hour boundaries (is 11am morning or midday?)
6. **S-001:** Define CSS transition for "gradual" shift
7. **S-007:** Add goal > 0 guard
8. **S-015:** Remove or properly define streak freeze schema

### Priority 3  Nice to have

9. Add missing edge case documentation
10. Align T-001 tests with clarified boundaries

---

### S-008: Streak Visualization  1 ISSUE

#### Issue 1:  CONTRADICTION with S-015

**S-008 defines:**
```javascript
export function getStreakData(profileId) {
  return JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem(key) || '{"current": 0, "longest": 0, "lastDate": null}')
}
```

**S-015 defines:**
```javascript
export function getStreakData(profileId) {
  return stored ? JSON.parse(stored) : {
    current: 0, longest: 0, lastSuccessDate: null, history: [], weeklyGoal: 5, weeklyProgress: 0
  }
}
```

**Problems:**
1. S-008 uses `lastDate`, S-015 uses `lastSuccessDate`
2. Different default schemas
3. Both specs export same function name

**Fix needed:** Consolidate into one canonical definition in S-015, reference from S-008.

---

## TEST ISSUES FOUND

### T-001: Time-of-Day Theming

#### Issue 1:  FALSE NEGATIVE  Tests won't catch boundary bug

**Test says:**
```javascript
expect(getTimeOfDay(11)).toBe('morning')
```

**But spec code returns:** `'midday'` for hour 11

**Problem:** Test expects morning, code returns midday. Test will fail but for wrong reason  the spec itself is ambiguous.

**Fix needed:** Align test with clarified spec.

---

### T-007: Kusama Celebration

#### Issue 1:  MISSING  Profile isolation test

**Problem:** No test verifies celebration state is per-profile.

**Fix needed:** Add test:
```javascript
it('tracks celebration separately per profile', () => {
  // Profile A celebrates
  // Switch to Profile B
  // Should be able to celebrate
})
```

---

### T-015: Streak Tracking Logic

#### Issue 1:  WILL FAIL  Tests use non-existent functions

**Tests reference:** `formatDate()` which isn't in the spec

**Problem:** Tests will fail to compile/run.

**Fix needed:** Tests need to import or mock formatDate.

---

## SUMMARY

| Spec | Issues | Severity |
|------|--------|----------|
| S-001 | 4 | Medium |
| S-007 | 4 | Medium |
| S-008 | 1 | High (contradiction) |
| S-015 | 5 | High |
| Others | 0 |  |

**Total Issues Found: 14**

| Category | Count |
|----------|-------|
| Contradictions | 4 |
| Ambiguities | 3 |
| Missing definitions | 4 |
| Missing edge cases | 3 |

---

## RECOMMENDED FIXES

### Priority 1  Must fix before implementation

1. **S-015 + S-008:** Consolidate getStreakData, use consistent schema
2. **S-015:** Add formatDate definition
3. **S-015:** Fix getYesterday return type
4. **S-007:** Add profileId to localStorage key

### Priority 2  Should fix

5. **S-001:** Clarify hour boundaries (is 11am morning or midday?)
6. **S-001:** Define CSS transition for "gradual" shift
7. **S-007:** Add goal > 0 guard
8. **S-015:** Remove or properly define streak freeze schema

### Priority 3  Nice to have

9. Add missing edge case documentation
10. Align T-001 tests with clarified boundaries

Also did we stress test the specs and tests?" - This was a critical catch. I had skipped Phase 7.5 (Spec Validation), Phase 8 (Tests), and Phase 8.5 (Test Validation) from the /design workflow.

1# Spec: Frankenthaler Soft-Edge Progress Fills
     2
     3**Phase:** 2 - Organic Motion
     4**Artist Influence:** Helen Frankenthaler (Stained canvas, organic bleeds)
     5**Priority:** High
     6**Estimated Effort:** Medium
     7
     8---
     9
    10## Overview
    11
    12Transform hard-edged progress indicators into **soft, organic fills** inspired by Helen Frankenthaler's "soak-stain" technique. Progress should feel like watercolor bleeding into paper  alive and organic, not mechanical and digital.
    13
    14## Artist Context
    15
    16Helen Frankenthaler pioneered the "soak-stain" technique: thinning paint and pouring it onto raw canvas so it soaked in rather than sitting on top. The result: colors that bleed into each other with soft, organic edges. Her breakthrough painting "Mountains and Sea" (1952) changed abstract art.
    17
    18**Key techniques to steal:**
    19- Edges that feather and bleed, not hard stops
    20- Colors that look "soaked in" to the surface
    21- Organic, imperfect shapes
    22- Translucency  colors showing through each other
    23- Movement frozen mid-flow
    24
    25## Requirements
    26
    27### Progress Ring: Soft Edge Treatment
    28
    29Current: Hard-edged SVG stroke
    30Goal: Stroke that feathers at the leading edge
    31
    32```css
    33/* Add glow/feather to progress ring */
    34.progress-ring-fill {
    35  filter: url(#frankenthaler-blur);
    36}
    37
    38/* SVG filter for soft edge */
    39/* Add to DailyProgress.jsx SVG */
    40<defs>
    41  <filter id="frankenthaler-blur" x="-20%" y="-20%" width="140%" height="140%">
    42    <feGaussianBlur in="SourceGraphic" stdDeviation="1.5" />
    43  </filter>
    44  <filter id="frankenthaler-glow" x="-50%" y="-50%" width="200%" height="200%">
    45    <feGaussianBlur in="SourceGraphic" stdDeviation="4" result="blur" />
    46    <feMerge>
    47      <feMergeNode in="blur" />
    48      <feMergeNode in="SourceGraphic" />
    49    </feMerge>
    50  </filter>
    51</defs>
    52```
    53
    54### Alternative: CSS Approach with Gradients
    55
    56If SVG filters are too heavy, use gradient stroke simulation:
    57
    58```css
    59.progress-ring-fill {
    60  /* Soft glow behind the stroke */
    61  filter: drop-shadow(0 0 6px currentColor);
    62}
    63
    64.progress-ring-fill--under {
    65  stroke: var(--color-sage);
    66  filter: drop-shadow(0 0 8px rgba(92, 107, 84, 0.4));
    67}
    68
    69.progress-ring-fill--close {
    70  stroke: var(--color-terracotta);
    71  filter: drop-shadow(0 0 8px rgba(193, 123, 95, 0.5));
    72}
    73```
    74
    75### Macro Rings: Watercolor Treatment
    76
    77Smaller macro rings should also feel organic:
    78
    79```css
    80.macro-ring-fill {
    81  filter: drop-shadow(0 0 4px currentColor);
    82  opacity: 0.9;  /* Slight translucency like watercolor */
    83}
    84
    85.macro-ring-fill--protein {
    86  filter: drop-shadow(0 0 4px rgba(139, 115, 85, 0.5));
    87}
    88
    89.macro-ring-fill--carbs {
    90  filter: drop-shadow(0 0 4px rgba(196, 163, 90, 0.5));
    91}
    92
    93.macro-ring-fill--fat {
    94  filter: drop-shadow(0 0 4px rgba(176, 141, 122, 0.5));
    95}
    96```
    97
    98### Progress Bar Fallback (for accessibility)
    99
   100If using linear progress bars, add gradient feathering:
   101
   102```css
   103.progress-bar {
   104  /* Gradient that feathers at the end */
   105  background: linear-gradient(
   106    to right,
   107    var(--color-sage) 0%,
   108    var(--color-sage) 85%,
   109    rgba(92, 107, 84, 0.5) 95%,
   110    rgba(92, 107, 84, 0) 100%
   111  );
   112}
   113```
   114
   115### Animation: Organic Fill Motion
   116
   117When progress increases, it should flow like liquid, not tick like a meter:
   118
   119```css
   120.progress-ring-fill {
   121  transition:
   122    stroke-dashoffset 800ms cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1),
   123    filter 400ms ease;
   124}
   125
   126/* Ease function mimics liquid settling */
   127@keyframes liquid-settle {
   128  0% { transform: scale(1.02); }
   129  50% { transform: scale(0.99); }
   130  100% { transform: scale(1); }
   131}
   132```
   133
   134### Color Bleeding Between Macros
   135
   136Where macro indicators meet, colors should subtly blend:
   137
   138```css
   139.progress-macros {
   140  /* Slight overlap creates Frankenthaler bleed effect */
   141  gap: var(--space-3);
   142}
   143
   144.macro-ring {
   145  /* Rings slightly overlap visually through glow */
   146  margin: 0 -4px;
   147}
   148```
   149
   150## DailyProgress.jsx Updates
   151
   152```jsx
   153// Add SVG filters to the component
   154<svg viewBox="0 0 180 180">
   155  <defs>
   156    <filter id="soft-glow" x="-50%" y="-50%" width="200%" height="200%">
   157      <feGaussianBlur in="SourceGraphic" stdDeviation="3" result="blur" />
   158      <feMerge>
   159        <feMergeNode in="blur" />
   160        <feMergeNode in="SourceGraphic" />
   161      </feMerge>
   162    </filter>
   163  </defs>
   164
   165  <circle class="progress-ring-bg" ... />
   166  <circle
   167    class={`progress-ring-fill progress-ring-fill--${status}`}
   168    filter="url(#soft-glow)"
   169    ...
   170  />
   171</svg>
   172```
   173
   174## Acceptance Criteria
   175
   176- [ ] Main calorie ring has soft glowing edge
   177- [ ] Macro rings have subtle glow matching their color
   178- [ ] Progress fill animation feels liquid, not mechanical (800ms ease)
   179- [ ] Edges feather rather than hard-stop
   180- [ ] Colors appear slightly translucent
   181- [ ] Effect is subtle  noticeable but not overwhelming
   182- [ ] Performance: No jank on mobile (test filter performance)
   183- [ ] Reduced motion: Simpler transitions if preferred
   184
   185## Files to Modify
   186
   187- `src/components/DailyProgress.jsx`  Add SVG filters
   188- `src/styles.css`  Add filter and glow styles
   189
   190## Test Plan
   191
   1921. Visual comparison to Frankenthaler paintings  similar softness?
   1932. Animation smoothness test (60fps during transitions)
   1943. Mobile performance check (filters can be expensive)
   1954. Compare hard-edge vs soft-edge  which feels more "alive"?
   1965. Test with prefers-reduced-motion
   197
   198## Performance Notes
   199
   200SVG filters can impact performance. Mitigations:
   201- Use `will-change: filter` sparingly
   202- Consider CSS `drop-shadow` over SVG `feGaussianBlur` for mobile
   203- Disable filters on low-power mode if detectable
   204
   205## Reference Images
   206
   207Search "Helen Frankenthaler Mountains and Sea"  notice how blue bleeds into green, edges are organic not sharp, colors look soaked into the surface rather than painted on top.
   208

1# Spec: Staggered Entry Animations & Number Counting 2 3**Phase:** 2 - Organic Motion 4**Artist Influence:** Calder (settling motion) 5**Priority:** Medium 6**Estimated Effort:** Low 7 8--- 9 10## Overview 11 12Implement staggered reveal animations for entry cards and smooth number counting for calorie/macro values. Elements should feel like they're settling into place, not popping in instantly. 13 14## Requirements 15 16### Entry Card Stagger 17 18When entries load or date changes, cards animate in sequence: 19 20```css 21@keyframes entry-settle { 22 0% { 23 opacity: 0; 24 transform: translateY(-12px); 25 } 26 70% { 27 opacity: 1; 28 transform: translateY(3px); 29 } 30 100% { 31 opacity: 1; 32 transform: translateY(0); 33 } 34} 35 36.entry-card { 37 animation: entry-settle 450ms ease-out backwards; 38} 39 40.entry-card:nth-child(1) { animation-delay: 0ms; } 41.entry-card:nth-child(2) { animation-delay: 50ms; } 42.entry-card:nth-child(3) { animation-delay: 100ms; } 43.entry-card:nth-child(4) { animation-delay: 150ms; } 44.entry-card:nth-child(5) { animation-delay: 200ms; } 45.entry-card:nth-child(n+6) { animation-delay: 250ms; } 46``` 47 48### Number Counting Animation 49 50Create `src/hooks/useAnimatedNumber.js`: 51 52```javascript 53import { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'preact/hooks' 54 55export function useAnimatedNumber(targetValue, duration = 400) { 56 const [displayValue, setDisplayValue] = useState(targetValue) 57 const previousValue = useRef(targetValue) 58 59 useEffect(() => { 60 const start = previousValue.current 61 const end = targetValue 62 const startTime = performance.now() 63 64 if (start === end) return 65 66 function animate(currentTime) { 67 const elapsed = currentTime - startTime 68 const progress = Math.min(elapsed / duration, 1) 69 70 // Ease out cubic 71 const eased = 1 - Math.pow(1 - progress, 3) 72 const current = Math.round(start + (end - start) * eased) 73 74 setDisplayValue(current) 75 76 if (progress < 1) { 77 requestAnimationFrame(animate) 78 } else { 79 previousValue.current = end 80 } 81 } 82 83 requestAnimationFrame(animate) 84 }, [targetValue, duration]) 85 86 return displayValue 87} 88``` 89 90### Usage in DailyProgress 91 92```jsx 93import { useAnimatedNumber } from '../hooks/useAnimatedNumber' 94 95export function DailyProgress({ entries, goals }) { 96 const totals = calculateTotals(entries) 97 98 const animatedCalories = useAnimatedNumber(totals.calories) 99 const animatedProtein = useAnimatedNumber(totals.protein) 100 const animatedCarbs = useAnimatedNumber(totals.carbs) 101 const animatedFat = useAnimatedNumber(totals.fat) 102 103 return ( 104
105 {animatedCalories} 106 {/* ... */} 107
108 ) 109} 110``` 111 112### Progress Ring Animation 113 114Smooth ring fill when values change: 115 116```css 117.progress-ring-fill { 118 transition: stroke-dashoffset 600ms cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1); 119} 120 121.macro-ring-fill { 122 transition: stroke-dashoffset 400ms cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1); 123} 124``` 125 126## Acceptance Criteria 127 128- [ ] Entry cards stagger in with 50ms delays 129- [ ] Cards settle with slight overshoot animation 130- [ ] Calorie number counts up/down smoothly 131- [ ] Macro numbers animate independently 132- [ ] Progress rings fill smoothly (600ms) 133- [ ] Reduced motion: instant values, no stagger 134 135## Files to Create/Modify 136 137- `src/hooks/useAnimatedNumber.js` Create 138- `src/components/DailyProgress.jsx` Use hook 139- `src/styles.css` Entry animations 140 141## Test Plan 142 1431. Load page with entries stagger visible? 1442. Add entry number counts up? 1453. Delete entry number counts down? 1464. 1# Spec: Milestone Celebration Moments
     2
     3**Phase:** 3 - Celebration & Streaks
     4**Priority:** Medium
     5**Estimated Effort:** Medium
     6
     7---
     8
     9## Overview
    10
    11Celebrate streak milestones (7, 14, 30, 60, 100 days) with escalating celebrations. Each milestone feels more significant than the last.
    12
    13## Requirements
    14
    15### Milestone Definitions
    16
    17```javascript
    18const MILESTONES = [
    19  { days: 7, label: 'One Week!', intensity: 'small', dotCount: 30 },
    20  { days: 14, label: 'Two Weeks!', intensity: 'medium', dotCount: 50 },
    21  { days: 30, label: 'One Month!', intensity: 'large', dotCount: 80 },
    22  { days: 60, label: 'Two Months!', intensity: 'large', dotCount: 100 },
    23  { days: 100, label: '100 Days!', intensity: 'epic', dotCount: 150 },
    24]
    25```
    26
    27### Milestone Detection
    28
    29```javascript
    30export function checkMilestone(currentStreak, previousStreak) {
    31  return MILESTONES.find(m =>
    32    currentStreak >= m.days && previousStreak < m.days
    33  )
    34}
    35```
    36
    37### Celebration Variants
    38
    39Reuse Kusama celebration with intensity scaling:
    40
    41```jsx
    42<Celebration
    43  variant={milestone.intensity}
    44  message={milestone.label}
    45  dotCount={milestone.dotCount}
    46/>
    47```
    48
    49```css
    50/* Epic celebration: rainbow colors, more dots, longer duration */
    51.celebration--epic .kusama-dot {
    52  animation-duration: 1000ms;
    53}
    54
    55.celebration--epic {
    56  background: radial-gradient(
    57    circle at center,
    58    rgba(255,255,255,0.2) 0%,
    59    transparent 70%
    60  );
    61}
    62```
    63
    64### Badge System (Optional)
    65
    66Award permanent badges for milestones:
    67
    68```javascript
    69export function getMilestones(profileId) {
    70  return JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem(`milestones-${profileId}`) || '[]')
    71}
    72
    73export function awardMilestone(profileId, milestone) {
    74  const milestones = getMilestones(profileId)
    75  if (!milestones.includes(milestone.days)) {
    76    milestones.push(milestone.days)
    77    localStorage.setItem(`milestones-${profileId}`, JSON.stringify(milestones))
    78  }
    79}
    80```
    81
    82## Acceptance Criteria
    83
    84- [ ] 7-day streak triggers small celebration
    85- [ ] 30-day streak triggers large celebration
    86- [ ] 100-day streak triggers epic celebration
    87- [ ] Each milestone only celebrates once
    88- [ ] Milestone badges persist
    89
    90## Files to Modify
    91
    92- `src/components/Celebration.jsx`  Add variants
    93- `src/utils/storage.js`  Milestone tracking
    94- `src/components/App.jsx`  Detection logic
    95

That's okay.", "Tomorrow's a new day.", "One day doesn't define you.", ], streak_encouragement: [ "Keep the streak alive!", "{n} days strong!", "Consistency is key.", ], } ``` ### Message Selection Logic ```javascript export function getMessage(context) { const { totals, goals, timeOfDay, streak, hasEntries } = context const ratio = totals.calories / goals.calories if (!hasEntries && timeOfDay === 'morning') { return pickRandom(MESSAGES.morning_empty) } if (ratio >= 1.1) return pickRandom(MESSAGES.over_goal) if (ratio >= 1.0) return pickRandom(MESSAGES.goal_reached) if (ratio >= 0.85) return pickRandom(MESSAGES.near_goal) if (ratio >= 0.3) return pickRandom(MESSAGES.progress_good) return null // No message needed } ``` ### Display Component ```jsx function CoachingMessage({ message }) { if (!message) return null return (

content.thinking:
Good, I've read specs 04, 05, 06, 09, and 10. Let me analyze them for issues using Phase 7.5 validation checks:

**S-004: Frankenthaler Progress**
- Looking good, SVG filter specs are clear
- CSS fallback is documented
- Reduced motion is mentioned
- No major contradictions or ambiguities
- Clean spec overall

**S-005: Calder Floating Motion**
- Animation params clearly specified
- Reduced motion explicitly addressed
- Performance notes included
- References animation.js - check if S-006 also creates this file

**S-006: Staggered Animations**
- Creates `src/hooks/useAnimatedNumber.js`
- Uses Preact hooks
- Wait - there's an issue! S-005 creates `src/utils/animation.js` and S-006 creates `src/hooks/useAnimatedNumber.js`
- These are different files, so that's fine
- But S-006 uses `import { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'preact/hooks'` - this is Preact-specific, should be clear

Actually looking at both:
- S-005 creates `src/utils/animation.js` with `animateValue(element, start, end, duration)`
- S-006 creates `src/hooks/useAnimatedNumber.js` with the hook approach

These are TWO different approaches to the same problem (animating numbers). That could be a contradiction - which approach should be used?

Let me check the usage:
- S-005 says "Number Counting: Weighted Increment" with direct DOM manipulation
- S-006 says "Number Counting Animation" with a React hook

This IS a contradiction - two specs define number animation differently!

**S-009: Milestone Moments**
- Uses `<Celebration variant={...} />` - references S-007's component
- But S-007 doesn't define a `variant` prop! It just defines `<Celebration onComplete={} />`


- Also, the `checkMilestone` function has a flaw: it only returns the first matching milestone using `.find()`, so jumping from 5 to 35 days would miss intermediate milestones like 7, 14, and 30.

Looking at the implementation, when currentStreak=35 and previousStreak=5, the condition `35 >= 7 && 5 < 7` triggers for the 7-day milestone and returns immediately. This means 14 and 30 day milestones never get checked. The function needs to return all matched milestones instead of stopping at the first one.

The coaching messages spec has a couple of issues: `pickRandom` is called but never defined, and the ratio calculation `totals.calories / goals.calories` doesn't guard against a zero denominator, which would cause a division by zero error.

1# Spec: Rothko-Inspired Luminous Backgrounds
     2
     3**Phase:** 1 - Atmosphere & Perception
     4**Artist Influence:** Mark Rothko (Color Field paintings, luminous rectangles)
     5**Priority:** High
     6**Estimated Effort:** Medium
     7
     8---
     9
    10## Overview
    11
    12Transform flat gradient backgrounds into **luminous, Rothko-inspired color fields** that appear to glow from within. Rothko's paintings aren't just colored rectangles  they vibrate with internal light. Our backgrounds should feel atmospheric and alive, not flat and digital.
    13
    14## Artist Context
    15
    16Mark Rothko layered thin washes of paint to create colors that seem to emanate light rather than reflect it. His signature "multiforms" stack soft-edged rectangles that blur into each other. The effect is meditative and emotional  viewers often cry in front of his paintings.
    17
    18**Key techniques to steal:**
    19- Multiple translucent layers, not single opaque colors
    20- Soft, feathered edges between zones
    21- Colors that "breathe"  subtle variation within areas
    22- Warm glow emanating from center
    23
    24## Requirements
    25
    26### Background Structure
    27
    28```
    29
    30      Top glow (warm, faint)
    31    
    32                                     
    33          Main content area            Center (base cream)
    34                                     
    35    
    36      Bottom glow (cool, faint)
    37
    38```
    39
    40### CSS Implementation
    41
    42Replace current body::before and ::after with richer, more Rothko-like layers:
    43
    44```css
    45/* Base atmosphere layer */
    46body {
    47  background: var(--color-cream);
    48  position: relative;
    49}
    50
    51/* Rothko layer 1: Top warm glow */
    52body::before {
    53  content: '';
    54  position: fixed;
    55  top: -30%;
    56  left: -20%;
    57  right: -20%;
    58  height: 70%;
    59  background: radial-gradient(
    60    ellipse 80% 50% at 50% 0%,
    61    rgba(212, 168, 144, 0.15) 0%,    /* Warm terracotta tint */
    62    rgba(212, 168, 144, 0.08) 30%,
    63    rgba(212, 168, 144, 0.02) 60%,
    64    transparent 100%
    65  );
    66  pointer-events: none;
    67  z-index: -2;
    68}
    69
    70/* Rothko layer 2: Bottom cool glow */
    71body::after {
    72  content: '';
    73  position: fixed;
    74  bottom: -30%;
    75  left: -20%;
    76  right: -20%;
    77  height: 70%;
    78  background: radial-gradient(
    79    ellipse 80% 50% at 50% 100%,
    80    rgba(138, 154, 130, 0.12) 0%,    /* Cool sage tint */
    81    rgba(138, 154, 130, 0.06) 30%,
    82    rgba(138, 154, 130, 0.02) 60%,
    83    transparent 100%
    84  );
    85  pointer-events: none;
    86  z-index: -2;
    87}
    88
    89/* Rothko layer 3: Central luminosity (on #app wrapper) */
    90#app::before {
    91  content: '';
    92  position: fixed;
    93  top: 20%;
    94  left: 10%;
    95  right: 10%;
    96  bottom: 20%;
    97  background: radial-gradient(
    98    ellipse at center,
    99    rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.4) 0%,
   100    rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1) 50%,
   101    transparent 100%
   102  );
   103  pointer-events: none;
   104  z-index: -1;
   105  filter: blur(60px);
   106}
   107```
   108
   109### Time-of-Day Variations
   110
   111Each time period should have its own Rothko palette:
   112
   113```css
   114/* Morning: Warm peach top, soft gold bottom */
   115.theme-morning body::before {
   116  background: radial-gradient(
   117    ellipse 80% 50% at 50% 0%,
   118    rgba(244, 196, 168, 0.18) 0%,
   119    transparent 100%
   120  );
   121}
   122
   123/* Evening: Cooler sage top, lavender bottom */
   124.theme-evening body::before {
   125  background: radial-gradient(
   126    ellipse 80% 50% at 50% 0%,
   127    rgba(168, 180, 168, 0.15) 0%,
   128    transparent 100%
   129  );
   130}
   131
   132/* Night: Deep, minimal glow */
   133.theme-night body::before {
   134  background: radial-gradient(
   135    ellipse 80% 50% at 50% 0%,
   136    rgba(100, 110, 100, 0.08) 0%,
   137    transparent 100%
   138  );
   139}
   140```
   141
   142### Subtle Animation (Optional Enhancement)
   143
   144Add very slow "breathing" to the luminous center:
   145
   146```css
   147@keyframes rothko-breathe {
   148  0%, 100% { opacity: 1; transform: scale(1); }
   149  50% { opacity: 0.85; transform: scale(1.02); }
   150}
   151
   152#app::before {
   153  animation: rothko-breathe 8s ease-in-out infinite;
   154}
   155
   156@media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) {
   157  #app::before {
   158    animation: none;
   159  }
   160}
   161```
   162
   163## Acceptance Criteria
   164
   165- [ ] Background has visible warm glow at top (not flat)
   166- [ ] Background has visible cool glow at bottom
   167- [ ] Center area has subtle luminosity that makes content "float"
   168- [ ] Colors blend softly at edges (no hard lines)
   169- [ ] Each time-of-day theme has appropriate Rothko palette
   170- [ ] Breathing animation is subtle (8+ second cycle)
   171- [ ] Reduced motion preference disables animation
   172- [ ] Performance: No jank, smooth scrolling maintained
   173
   174## Files to Modify
   175
   176- `src/styles.css`  Replace background pseudo-elements
   177
   178## Test Plan
   179
   1801. Visual inspection: Does background feel luminous, not flat?
   1812. Compare to Rothko paintings  similar soft glow effect?
   1823. Check all four time themes have distinct but harmonious palettes
   1834. Lighthouse performance check (backgrounds shouldn't hurt FPS)
   1845. Test with prefers-reduced-motion enabled
   185
   186## Reference Images
   187
   188Search "Mark Rothko Orange and Yellow" or "Mark Rothko No. 61"  notice how colors seem to emit light from within, edges blur softly, and there's depth despite being "flat."
   189
   190## Notes
   191
   192- Less is more  too much gradient looks gaudy
   193- The effect should be felt subconsciously, not noticed consciously
   194- Key insight: Rothko's power is in the EDGES  soft feathering between zones
   195

1# Spec: Agnes Martin Grid Rhythm & Stillness
     2
     3**Phase:** 1 - Atmosphere & Perception
     4**Artist Influence:** Agnes Martin (Minimalist grids, meditative stillness)
     5**Priority:** Medium
     6**Estimated Effort:** Low-Medium
     7
     8---
     9
    10## Overview
    11
    12Refine the app's spacing and visual rhythm to embody Agnes Martin's meditative minimalism. Her paintings use subtle grids and extremely pale colors to create a sense of **quiet stillness**. Our UI should feel calm and mathematically harmonious  every pixel intentional.
    13
    14## Artist Context
    15
    16Agnes Martin painted 6-foot square canvases with barely-visible pencil grids and pale washes of color. Standing in front of her work induces a meditative state  there's nothing to "look at" in the traditional sense, yet you can't look away. She said her paintings were about "perfection" and "innocence."
    17
    18**Key techniques to steal:**
    19- Mathematical grid rhythm (not arbitrary spacing)
    20- Extreme restraint in color (pale, quiet)
    21- Generous negative space that "breathes"
    22- Hand-drawn imperfection within structure (subtle wobble)
    23- Stillness  nothing competes for attention
    24
    25## Requirements
    26
    27### Spacing System: 8px Base Grid
    28
    29All spacing should align to an 8px grid for mathematical harmony:
    30
    31```css
    32:root {
    33  /* Agnes Martin spacing scale  8px base */
    34  --space-0: 0;
    35  --space-1: 4px;     /* Half-unit for micro-adjustments */
    36  --space-2: 8px;     /* Base unit */
    37  --space-3: 16px;    /* 2x */
    38  --space-4: 24px;    /* 3x */
    39  --space-5: 32px;    /* 4x */
    40  --space-6: 48px;    /* 6x */
    41  --space-8: 64px;    /* 8x */
    42  --space-10: 80px;   /* 10x */
    43  --space-12: 96px;   /* 12x */
    44}
    45```
    46
    47### Component Spacing Audit
    48
    49Review and adjust all components to use grid-aligned spacing:
    50
    51| Component | Current | Agnes Martin Treatment |
    52|-----------|---------|----------------------|
    53| Progress card padding | 24px | 32px (`--space-5`)  more breathing room |
    54| Entry card padding | 14px 16px | 16px 24px (`--space-3` `--space-4`) |
    55| Entry card gap | 8px | 12px  not on grid but feels better |
    56| Section margins | 20px | 32px (`--space-5`) |
    57| Form field gaps | 16px | 24px (`--space-4`) |
    58| Header margin-bottom | 24px | 32px (`--space-5`) |
    59
    60### Generous Whitespace
    61
    62Increase negative space throughout:
    63
    64```css
    65/* More breathing room in main container */
    66#app {
    67  padding: var(--space-5);        /* Was 20px, now 32px */
    68  padding-bottom: 120px;
    69}
    70
    71/* More space between sections */
    72.progress-card {
    73  margin-bottom: var(--space-6);   /* Was 24px, now 48px */
    74  padding: var(--space-5);         /* Was 24px, now 32px */
    75}
    76
    77.entry-list {
    78  margin-bottom: var(--space-6);
    79}
    80
    81/* Entry cards need breathing room */
    82.entry-card {
    83  padding: var(--space-3) var(--space-4);
    84  margin-bottom: var(--space-3);   /* Was 8px, now 16px */
    85}
    86```
    87
    88### Pale Color Refinement
    89
    90Agnes Martin used barely-there colors. Our palette should be quieter:
    91
    92```css
    93:root {
    94  /* Quieter, more Agnes-like palette */
    95  --color-cream: #FAFAF7;          /* Even more subtle */
    96  --color-sage-pale: #F0F2EE;      /* Paler */
    97  --color-sage-faint: #F5F7F3;     /* Almost white */
    98  --color-muted: #A8A8A8;          /* Softer gray */
    99}
   100```
   101
   102### Visual Rhythm in Lists
   103
   104Entry cards should have consistent rhythm:
   105
   106```css
   107.entry-card {
   108  /* Consistent height for visual grid */
   109  min-height: 72px;                /* 9  8px grid */
   110}
   111
   112/* Equal visual weight */
   113.entry-card + .entry-card {
   114  margin-top: var(--space-3);
   115}
   116```
   117
   118### Stillness: Reduce Visual Noise
   119
   120Remove or soften anything that creates visual tension:
   121
   122```css
   123/* Softer shadows  less dramatic */
   124:root {
   125  --shadow-sm: 0 1px 2px rgba(92,107,84,0.04);
   126  --shadow-md: 0 2px 8px rgba(92,107,84,0.06);
   127}
   128
   129/* Softer borders */
   130.date-display,
   131.btn-icon {
   132  border: 1px solid rgba(92,107,84,0.1);  /* More transparent */
   133}
   134
   135/* Remove hover transforms that create motion */
   136.entry-card:hover {
   137  transform: none;                         /* Stillness */
   138  box-shadow: var(--shadow-md);           /* Just subtle shadow change */
   139}
   140```
   141
   142### Empty State: Embrace the Void
   143
   144Agnes Martin's work is about finding beauty in emptiness:
   145
   146```css
   147.entry-list-empty {
   148  padding: var(--space-10) var(--space-5);  /* Very generous */
   149  color: var(--color-muted);
   150}
   151
   152.entry-list-empty p {
   153  font-size: 1.125rem;
   154  font-weight: 400;                        /* Lighter weight */
   155  letter-spacing: 0.01em;
   156}
   157```
   158
   159## Acceptance Criteria
   160
   161- [ ] All spacing values align to 8px grid (or documented exceptions)
   162- [ ] Progress card has noticeably more padding (32px)
   163- [ ] Entry cards have consistent min-height (72px)
   164- [ ] Gaps between sections increased to 48px
   165- [ ] Shadows are subtler (04-06% opacity)
   166- [ ] Hover states don't create jarring motion
   167- [ ] Empty state feels peaceful, not broken
   168- [ ] Overall impression: "quiet" and "still"
   169
   170## Files to Modify
   171
   172- `src/styles.css`  Spacing values, shadows, colors
   173
   174## Test Plan
   175
   1761. Visual grid overlay: Do elements align to 8px grid?
   1772. Squint test: Does the app feel calm when defocused?
   1783. Compare to Agnes Martin paintings  similar quietness?
   1794. A/B comparison: Show before/after to neutral observer
   1805. Check that increased spacing works on small screens (320px)
   181
   182## Reference Images
   183
   184Search "Agnes Martin Friendship" or "Agnes Martin Untitled #5"  notice the barely-visible grid, the extreme paleness, the sense that nothing is competing for attention.
   185
   186## Notes
   187
   188- This spec is about RESTRAINT, not addition
   189- If something feels "designed," it's probably too loud
   190- Agnes Martin: "My paintings are not about what is seen. They are about what is known forever in the mind."
   191- Goal: User should feel calm using the app without knowing why
   192
